item.title: Zeros of the Exponential Function
item.description: I recently stumbled upon the following animation which I made upon learning a somewhat “random” fact about the exponential function while doing my Ph.D. I stumbled upon it, because I often remember it. It is a random fact, but a very pretty and surprising one. Several pretty aspects come to mind: e^z has no zeroes in the complex plane, and that Taylor Series converges in the whole complex plane, so the n zeroes of p_n(z) need to be escaping as z->infty.
